purpose: Renders a tabbed modal dialog for viewing and editing all configuration facets of a single action definition including actor, targeting, variables, outcome, and probability
Lets the user configure which entity kind performs an action and what conditions that actor must meet, including optional instigator entity selection
Provides editable fields for an action's basic identity (ID, name, description, enabled toggle) and a delete button
Lets the user configure which entity kind performs an action and what conditions that actor must meet, including optional instigator entity selection
Allows the user to optionally define a secondary instigator entity that triggers the action alongside the primary actor
Lets the user define the strategy and filters for selecting which entities are valid targets of an action
Lets the user add, edit, and remove named computed variables that can be referenced throughout an action's configuration
Lets the user build the list of entity mutations that an action applies when it executes, with per-type default values
Lets the user set the base success chance, base weight, and pressure-driven modifiers that control how likely an action is to fire

Displays compact labeled count badges for each category of domain items (generators, systems, eras, etc.) that reference a given schema element, showing an orphan indicator when nothing references it
